desc: A visual exploration of Diwali celebrations in Mumbai, India, showcasing the vibrant decorations, illuminated temples, and joyous festivities.

sttData.content: Diwali, the Hindu festival of lights, is celebrated in India and other countries with great enthusiasm. The festival marks the victory of light over darkness and good over evil.
sttData.speaker: Anchorman

sttData.content: The celebrations begin with cleaning and decorating homes and temples. People wear new clothes and prepare traditional delicacies to offer to the deities and share with their loved ones.
sttData.speaker: Expert

sttData.content: The most iconic Diwali decoration is the 'Rangoli', a colorful design made using flowers, colored powders, and rice. It is believed that Goddess Lakshmi visits homes adorned with Rangoli.
sttData.speaker: Expert

sttData.content: Fireworks and crackers are an integral part of Diwali celebrations. They signify the victory of Lord Rama over the demon king Ravana, bringing joy and happiness to people.
sttData.speaker: Anchorman

sttData.content: As the sun sets, people gather around temples and light diyas (oil lamps) and candles. They offer prayers to the deities for blessings and prosperity.
sttData.speaker: Expert

stt.sttSummary: Diwali, the Hindu festival of lights, is celebrated with cleaning, decorating, new clothes, traditional delicacies, Rangoli, fireworks, and prayers to the deities for blessings and prosperity.
